item.description: Intro to asymmetric encryption # Until now, we’ve been using symmetric cryptography. This means that both Alice and Bob are sharing a secret key. In asymmetric cryptography, Alice and Bob have their own secret keys. They also both have public keys. Both public and private keys are created at the same time. We want to provide these services using asymmetric cryptography: Encryption Alice encrypts a message to be sent to Bob using Bob’s public key \[\begin{aligned} A \to \text{Encrypt}(B_\text{pub}, x) \to B \end{aligned}\] Bob decrypts this message using his private key Authentication
